de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions
Class CurriedLetRec

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.CurriedLet
          de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.CurriedLetRec
All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyPrintPriorities, PrettyPrintable, Cloneable
public final class CurriedLetRec
extends CurriedLet

Instances of this class represent curried let rec expressions in the expression hierarchy.

Version:
$Rev: 698 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
LetRec, CurriedLet

Constructor Summary
CurriedLetRec(String[] identifiers, MonoType[] types, Expression e1, Expression e2)
          Allocates a new CurriedLetRec instance.
 
Method Summary
 CurriedLetRec clone()
          Clones this expression, so that the result is an expression equal to this expression, but with a different object identity. This is used in the substitution of expressions to be able to distinguish different appearances of the same identifier in the pretty printer, as required by the highlighting of bound variables. But note that for certain kinds of Expressions, like Constants, this method returns the same object, as constants are not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.
 TreeSet<String> free()
          Returns the free (unbound) identifiers within the expression, e.g. the name of the identifier for an identifier expression or the free identifiers for its sub expressions in applications, abstractions and recursions. The default implementation in the Expression class uses introspection to determine the sub expressions and calls free() recursively on all sub expressions. Some of the derived classes might need to override this method if they represents a binding mechanism, like Let, or if they don't have sub expressions, but provide free identifiers, like Identifier.
 CurriedLetRec substitute(String id, Expression e)
          Substitutes the expression e for the identifier id in this expression, and returns the resulting expression. The resulting expression may be a new Expression object or if no substitution took place, the same object. The method operates recursively.
 CurriedLetRec substitute(TypeSubstitution substitution)
          Applies the type substitution to this expression, to be exact, to the types within this expression, and returns the new expression with the new types. If the expression does not contain any types, this method simply returns a reference to this expression.
 PrettyStringBuilder toPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyStringBuilderFactory factory)
          Returns the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression. The pretty string builder must be allocated from the specified factory, which is currently always the default factory, but may also be another factory in the future.

Constructor Detail

CurriedLetRec

public CurriedLetRec(String[] identifiers,
                     MonoType[] types,
                     Expression e1,
                     Expression e2)
Allocates a new CurriedLetRec instance.

Parameters:
identifiers - an array with atleast two identifiers, where the first identifier is the name to use for the function and the remaining identifiers specify the parameters for the function.
types - the types for the identifiers, see CurriedLet.getTypes() for an extensive description.
e1 - the function body.
e2 - the second expression.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the identifiers array contains less than two identifiers, or the arity of identifiers and types does not match.
NullPointerException - if identifiers, types, e1 or e2 is null.
See Also:
CurriedLet.CurriedLet(String[], MonoType[], Expression, Expression)
Method Detail

clone

public CurriedLetRec clone()
Clones this expression, so that the result is an expression equal to this expression, but with a different object identity. This is used in the substitution of expressions to be able to distinguish different appearances of the same identifier in the pretty printer, as required by the highlighting of bound variables. But note that for certain kinds of Expressions, like Constants, this method returns the same object, as constants are not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.

Overrides:
clone in class CurriedLet
Returns:
a deep clone of this object, or a reference to this if the expression is a constant or another special kind of expression not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.
See Also:
CurriedLet.clone()

free

public TreeSet<String> free()
Returns the free (unbound) identifiers within the expression, e.g. the name of the identifier for an identifier expression or the free identifiers for its sub expressions in applications, abstractions and recursions. The default implementation in the Expression class uses introspection to determine the sub expressions and calls free() recursively on all sub expressions. Some of the derived classes might need to override this method if they represents a binding mechanism, like Let, or if they don't have sub expressions, but provide free identifiers, like Identifier.

Overrides:
free in class CurriedLet
Returns:
the set of free (unbound) identifiers within the expression.
See Also:
CurriedLet.free()

substitute

public CurriedLetRec substitute(TypeSubstitution substitution)
Applies the type substitution to this expression, to be exact, to the types within this expression, and returns the new expression with the new types. If the expression does not contain any types, this method simply returns a reference to this expression.

Overrides:
substitute in class CurriedLet
Parameters:
substitution - the type substitution to apply.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
See Also:
CurriedLet.substitute(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.typechecker.TypeSubstitution)

substitute

public CurriedLetRec substitute(String id,
                                Expression e)
Substitutes the expression e for the identifier id in this expression, and returns the resulting expression. The resulting expression may be a new Expression object or if no substitution took place, the same object. The method operates recursively.

Overrides:
substitute in class CurriedLet
Parameters:
id - the name of the identifier.
e - the Expression to substitute.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
See Also:
CurriedLet.substitute(java.lang.String, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression)

toPrettyStringBuilder

public PrettyStringBuilder toPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyStringBuilderFactory factory)
Returns the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression. The pretty string builder must be allocated from the specified factory, which is currently always the default factory, but may also be another factory in the future.

Overrides:
toPrettyStringBuilder in class CurriedLet
Parameters:
factory - the PrettyStringBuilderFactory used to allocate the required pretty string builders to pretty print this expression.
Returns:
the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression.
See Also:
CurriedLet.toPrettyStringBuilder(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.PrettyStringBuilderFactory)
